title: Thoughts on Human Computer Interaction (HCI)
content: How is this subject, is it a comparatively easier subject then the other electives in 5th sem.

comments.body: Easy to study- yes. Easy to score- no

The issue with electives at PES is that the difficulty keeps changing. Sometimes they're easy, sometimes they're difficult. It's very unpredictable. It depends on the batch and also the paper that year. 

HCI as a course is pretty bland if you're not interested in it. It's entirely theoretical, but it's easy-to-memorise theory. ISAs/ESA  questions are basically quoting content from slides - there is no application of knowledge here. So it's basically an either you-know-the-answer-or-you-don't kind of paper. If you memorise well, you can score well. But if you're someone who cannot memorise large chunks of info, then you'll struggle. 

In my year, it was pretty easy. But then the year after mine it became really difficult. Then it was easy again for a year.
why is it so, are the papers set to be difficult?
